intro: Tropaeolum matthewsii, commonly known as the Mexican nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Tropaeolaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, edible flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces bright orange or red flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its seeds are also edible and have a peppery flavor similar to that of watercress. Tropaeolum matthewsii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its colorful blooms and culinary uses.
